hey guys: I got a little problem with a touchpad on an acer laptop
it has a button to switch the touchpad on and off
to get that button to work I needed that hack described here: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/374459/comments/68

now the button is working but the funny thing is - if you log out (or restart or whatever) the computer while the touchpad is disabled it will work if gdm starts but stops working after the user has logged in
you can fix that problem if you disable it in the login screen before login in
also trying to enable it when logged in with the user with the command "synclient TouchpadOff=0" doesn't work
so how does ubuntu/gnome store the touchpad settings and what could cause the corruption?
it seems like the user setting and the general xsetting (which is that the touchpad is turned on from start) differ than it wont change the state anymore
